intro: Erianthemum ngamicum, commonly known as the Ngamikum wildflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in open woodland or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
